reviews.review_title: Leslie Nielsen, the king of travesty
reviews.content: This morning I heard a really sad news, that Leslie Nielsen has passed away at the age of 84 to pneumonia.This man became known from a numerous spoof movies.He really was the master when it came to parodies.David Zucker's, Jim Abrahams' and Jerry Zucker's The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1988) is one we all know.In it Leslie plays Detective Frank Drebin, the character we first saw in the short-lived Police Squad series (1982).Frank causes a lot of damage, but he also gets the criminals in the end.In the first movie Drebin tries to safe the Queen Elizabeth II from assassination.Frank's sweetheart is played by Priscilla Presley.George Kennedy is Ed Hocken.O.J. Simpson, when he was mainly known from football and acting, plays Nordberg.Ricardo Montalban is Vincent Ludwig.Jeannette Charles is the Queen.Ed Williams plays Ted Olsen.We also see 'Weird Al' Yankovic in the movie.And Dr. Joyce Brothers.The movie has lots of funny stuff that has made me laugh many times over the years.Take the baseball scene, for instance.So thanks for the laughs, Leslie!

One of the funniest movies of all time. I am glad that I got The Naked Gun as one of the movies in my collection. Out of all 3 in the trilogy nothing is as good as the first!I have seen this movie at least 15 times and each time is as good as the first. Leslie Nielson fits the role to perfection. A quaky, dorky, and very accident prone cop. The cast includes some famous celebrities as well. Priscilla Presly and O.J. Simpson are just a few of the cast members.If you have not seen The Naked Gun, I strongly recommend that you check it out! A great movie! 7 out of 10

Seriously. This movie is superb. Leslie Nielsen does a very funny job of being Lt. Frank Drebin, and I thought every joke in this movie (pretty much anyway) was very funny. It reminds me a lot of Monty Python, fresh and funny! Heck, the acting is great too! The whole movie is great! Everything about it rocks! This is one of my top 10 favorite movies, and I definitely recommend it to any comedy fan, unless you don't like comedy too much, which is possible if you're a girl or are just not entertained by stupid comedy like this, but I know that I loved it.10/10

I don't know how many times I have watched this film, but it's many. And even though i don't laugh as much as I did the first times, I still have no problem putting this movie at the all-time top of comedies. The beginning of it, with all the dictators, is especially well-made. My salute to the people who came ut with the idea of that one. Leslie Nielsen is simply the king of comedies, especially slapstick-comedies like this one. Movies like this one are so crazy that there aren't even a tiny little serious microsecond in the whole movie, and that's one of the reasons it's so great. It's just totally crazy. This movie will never get too old. Humour and laughter is indeed timeless.

Just watched "Naked Gun" for the first time ever and while I enjoyed it, I am slightly disappointed. Not the comedy classic I expected it to be, rather just more of an average spoof/comedy, which at 1.5 hours still feels long. The baseball scene at the end felt anticlimactic and too drawn out, though there were some good lines and gags interspersed throughout; however the plot was just too minimalist, I expected a little more substance even from a spoof. So, 5/10 rating.** Update: I watched the sequel Naked Gun 2.5 and liked it much better, giving it a 9/10. But the third film in the series I liked less than the first and gave it a 4/10. So in my view, just watch the second one (Naked Gun 2.5) it is hilarious, the other two are just ok.

If you liked or love 'Airplane' or early Mel Brooks movies, you will love this movie. It is a Slapstick/Spoof in that same vain. For younger generations who review, it seems that for all the time spent going through others reviews, box office numbers etc... and what other people think of movies,
STOP IT! It just drives me NUTS before leaving a review or decided if YOU like the movie, you guys have to check with others to determine if you're allowed to like it and then complain that it has a low rating.
Generations are always talking about change and it takes only one, so let's start small and start with the arts. (You effect a rating)

reviews.review_title: Warning: this movie WILL make your sides hurt
reviews.content: Well, it sure made my sides hurt, and my friends', and my familys', and my classmates', and every stranger, co worker I've ever talked too, etc. This, "Top secret", and "Airplane" are the funniest spoofs ever. I don't even know where to start. If I was to list every funny thing from this film here, I would be writing a review 10 pages long. I'd be writing a book! And almost everyone on earth who hasn't been on Mars since 1989 most likely has almost every joke in this movie memorized by now. Just about everybody who will read this review will already know every joke. But I'll still name three out of my fifty favorite jokes here. One: Leslie starting to make a speech and the way he started his speech when everyone was actually there to see Weird Al Yankavits. Two: Leslie forgetting to take off his microphone at city hall when going to the mens room. Three: the whole scene at Ludwig's apartment from accidentally setting it on fire straight through to the concrete statues joke. Also, Ludwig was played by Riccardo Montablan for those who've recognized him from the love interest in a couple of Esther Williams' films. The Marx brothers were the best and funniest films of Hollywood's golden age. And Naked gun, Top secret, and Airplane are the best, funniest movies from the more modern times. Rest in peace Leslie Nielson. You HAVE made difference.

reviews.review_title: The Zucker's Original Cop Caper is Silly and Slappy and Stupendous
reviews.content: From the files of Police Squad! An unlikely revival of a short-lived TV series that's pure slapstick 101; goofball comedy in its most condensed form, with equal parts love and scorn for the long line of self-serious detective shows it shamelessly lampoons. Like the Zucker brothers' previous comic jam, Airplane!, this is largely an excuse to spill jokes, gags and puns at an incredible pace, with zany antics and wacky laughs piled so high that I'm impressed they found room for a story in-between. Granted, it's not much of a story - the nonsensical villainous plot involves mind-control bracelets and the Queen of England - but it's enough to connect the dots, to feed the writers with fresh material for new riffs and keep the whole production from growing stale.Leslie Nielsen appears in his best-remembered role, standing tall as the hard-boiled, yet totally brainless, police detective Frank Drebin. Not necessarily the first stop in his transition from dramatic roles, but certainly the moment where the dam broke and he slid into full-time, high-profile comedies. He's the anchor that holds the whole rocking boat in place, a real pro at maintaining straight faces in the most trying of circumstances. The supporting players are less consistent: Priscilla Presley sure wasn't hired for her acting, and it's awkward seeing OJ Simpson in a sympathetic light (though, at the time, it was a good casting), but George Kennedy is excellent as Frank's long-suffering partner and Ricardo Montalbán clearly relishes the chance to get slummy and slimy with a loose villainous role.Bottom line, The Naked Gun doesn't aim to be more than a silly, light flood of themed punchlines, and it nails that bullseye. Repeatedly. Not every swing is a smash hit, but the sheer volume of material ensures a side-splitter or two in most scenes, with a few achieving near-legendary status. I could watch these YouTube clips until the end of time.

This movie was one of the funniest ever made. The bathroom/press conference scene was a classic and had me on my knees with laughter when I saw it in the theatre. I loved it. Plenty of great lines, sight gags, and other related jokes/humor were just great. Absolutely marvelous.*** out of ****

reviews.review_title: Not as funny as Airplane was!
reviews.content: I don't know how many of you will agree with me on this one but I found this film to be less funny than Airplane. And the primary reason was the inconsistencies that were seemingly prominent in its writing.Whilst Zucker Brothers' Airplane had me uproariously cracking up throughout its runtime, The Naked Gun failed to maintain its laughter ride for the entirety. The first half is good, it served me enough in terms of comedy and dumb, stupid entertainment; but right after the romantic interest was given an introduction the element of fun came to a standstill.Do not get me wrong, I am not suggesting that was completely unnecessary, even Airplane earlier had a romantic reconciliation to exhibit but that somewhat seemed pertinent, it had a direct bearing on the outcome of the narrative whereas here in this case it felt nothing but a trivial addition of inconsequentiality.Anyways, Leslie Nielsen was fantastic and I cannot wait to see more of him.

reviews.review_title: One of the best spoofs ever made.
reviews.content: Incompetent Cop Frank Drebin (The late Leslie Nielsen) from Police Squad. He is investigating the attempted murder of his partner Nordberg (The infamous O.J. Simpson). He finds himself in a conspiracy that the millionaire Vincent Ludwig (The late Ricardo Montalban) is planning to assassinated Queen Elizabeth the Second (Jeannette Charles).Directed by David Zucker (Scary Movie 3 and Scary Movie 4, Ruthless People, Top Secret!) made an enjoyable comedic spoof, based on the failed TV Show. Which the TV Show was created by David Zucker, Jim Abrahams and Jerry Zucker. The late Nielsen is terrific as a clueless police detective. Priscilla Presley is amusing as Drebin's love interest. Oscar-Winner:George Kennedy appears in a supporting role as Ed Hocken from the Police Squad.DVD has an good anamorphic Widescreen (1.78:1) transfer and an digitally remastered Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround Sound. DVD includes an entertaining commentary track by David Zucker, Producer:Robert K. Weiss (The Blues Brothers, Dragnet, Tommy Boy) and Host:Peter Tilden. DVD also includes the original theatrical trailer. "The Naked Gun:From the Files of Police Squad!" is one of the most memorable spoofs ever made and it was certainly one of the funniest comedies made in the 1980's. There is some familiar faces in bit parts. TV Version adds some additional footage. Don't miss this Leslie Nielsen classic, Mr. Nielsen we will miss you. Written by Jerry Zucker (First Knight, Ghost, Rat Race), Jim Abrahams (Hot Shots! and Hot Shots! Part Deux, Big Business, Jane Austin's Mafia!), David Zucker and Pat Proft (Bachelor Party, High School High, Police Academy). (****/*****).

Zucker, Abrahams and Zucker have produced another zany and outrageous comedy. This time we follow the misadventures of cop Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen), a character portrayed in the TV series "Police Squad". Hence the full title of the movie: "The Naked Gun - from the Files of Police Squad".This 'Z.A.Z.' film has its moments, but few are absolutely hilarious as were the many fine comedy moments in both "Top Secret" and "Flying High". Look out for the scene where Drebin searches his partner's jacket by mistake, the definite highlight. Worth a look anyway, "The Naked Gun" will almost certainly raise a chuckle or two.Sunday, November 17, 1991 - Video

If you don't love the Naked Gun or The Police Squad TV series you are dead from the head up .These comedies throw hilarious jokes at you like they are being fired from a machine gun and there are so many it's almost impossible to see them all !This film reminds me of Airplane! A classic which incidentally had Leslie Nielson in it too.There is someone about his face that makes you laugh , even if he's playing it straight and the best and most complimentary thing I can say about Nielson and Frank Drebin is he is the American Inspector Clouseau . The comedy isn't as subtle as The Pink Panther films but it's just as funny .The older I get the less I find comedy films funny but even after over thirty years , it's impossible not to laugh at The Naked Gun .Puerile yes , but who cares . They don't make films like this anymore and that's a crying shame .

I saw The Naked Gun this weekend, for the first time in several years (actually, the first time I had seen ANY of the NG flicks since the OJ murder trial started). I found it as hilarious as ever, like most of the Zucker and/or Abrams schtick.People who hated Airplane or deplored the Marx Brothers will hate this one (and its sequels), too. Those who enjoy a good satire of the traditional formula police story, as well as some nifty sight gags and puns, will love it.Leslie Nielson was born for the role of Frank Dreben. Viewers who may have grown tired of his straight-faced hijinx, which has grown into a chiche after three NG movies, Airplane, the short-lived (but awesome) Police Squad TV show and numerous commercials, should be reminded just how funny the man was when the schtick was new.George Kennedy is a perfect foil for Nielson, as Allen North was in the TV series. Priscilla Presley is solid as the love interest. The movie might be even better without the long romance segments. The Zucker/Abrams crew, though, is no doubt making just such a point about the police/detective shows and movies they are spoofing. I did get a kick out of the fun day montage, showing them walking out of a theatre, laughing heartily, then the camera pulling back & showing that they had just watched "Platoon."So many gags are really enjoyable. Nielson and Kennedy searching the distinguished couple at the queen's reception is priceless. With Kennedy behind the man, Nielson frisks him, then reaches for his pockets. Instead, he reaches too far & pulls Kennedy's gun out of HIS pocket. Convinced they have a hot one, Nielson sticks another hand in the man's pocket (so he thinks; actually it's Kennedy's pocket again) and pulls out Kennedy's wallet. One expects them to accuse the man of impersonating a police officer. Instead Nielson gasps "Ed, he's got a picture of your wife in his wallet!" after which the normally reserved Kennedy promptly belts the poor man in the mouth!Of course Ricardo Montalban was great in virtually everything he did and is outstanding as the villainous Vincent Ludwig The entire cast is strong and the baseball game is truly memorable. Dreben impersonating an international opera star and the home plate umpire are classics. I also loved the fake footage being seen on the `Angel Vision,' including a player run over by a car in the infield and a baserunner attacked by a lion at second base, followed by Mel Allen's patented `How ABOUT that!' lolThe move is at least as good as I remembered it being. Rent it or buy it - and, by all means, find a copy of the six `Police Squad' TV episodes! They're hilarious, too!

The Naked Gun came out when I was only eight years old, and way too young to appreciate a lot of its jokes.  Still, there was enough low-brow and physical comedy to crack me up, and it was one of my early favorite movies. And while I've outgrown a lot of stuff I liked at that age, I can still watch The Naked Gun and laugh, and I even get the jokes that went way over my head as a young'un.The film, subtitled From The Files of Police Squad!, couldn't be simpler, and that's the way they want it.  Lt. Frank Drebin has to to clear the name of his partner Norberg (The now ironic OJ Simpson) while protecting the life of Queen Elisabeth, in Los Angeles on a tour of America.  For ninety minutes, the movie exploits, and frequently ignores, the plot in the name of jokes.  Just plain and simple, this movie is out to make you laugh, and it will sink to any depth to get there.  Everyone has their favorite Naked Gun moment; mine has to be Leslie Nielsen performing the worst rendition of the Star Spangled Banner in history.  His fireside monologue about a lost love who played the harp is priceless as well.Kudos also to Ricardo Montalban's  performance as real estate tycoon Vincent Ludwig.  So ridiculous is his accent and accentuations that he makes even straight lines funny.  I'll never get tired of him saying to a frightened Priscilla Presley, "It was easy my dear!  You forget I spent two years as a building contractor!"  Stupidty at its funniest.This is not a classic, and it didn't change the face of comedy (It is after all, a simple application of the "Airplane!" formula to cop movies), but The Naked Gun is funny, and it never loses its charm no matter how many times you watch it.

One of the great comedy classics of the '80s, there's nary a miss or pause from start to finish as Nielsen tries to foil plot to kill Queen of England.  Kennedy and Presley are great in supporting roles.  Concept started out as 6 equally funny TV episodes six years earlier.  Inspired two amusing if inferior sequels, as well as a number of really unfunny copycats.

reviews.review_title: A heart warming, pleasant and very funny film!
reviews.content: I remember i was at a friends house, one day, we were on youtube and he decided to type in "The Naked Gun" then, i'd never heard of it, the only Nielsen flick i ever saw was Spy Hard. Anyway we watched the best bits of this film, i enjoyed it very much and then we went to Xtravision to rent out 33 1/3, it wasn't there, so we rented out this one, which was i kinda bad idea considering we already saw the best bits, but i still enjoyed it, and it encouraged me to buy 33 1/3, which i really REALLY enjoyed, all i need now is 2 1/2......Anyway about the film, well it's great, there are some top-notch jokes, and the odd unfunny joke but all comedies have them, it's a great way to spend an hour and a half and would recommend it to anybody in dire need of a good laugh, i can guarantee you, it'll be worth it, in fact "It's impossible not to laugh!" 8/10

reviews.review_title: A funny spoof, with continuous slapstick
reviews.content: The only spoof movie I saw starring Leslie Nielsen before this one was "Spy Hard", and like so many others, I did not care much for it. However, knowing that "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!" was a lot more popular (as I'm sure you can tell by comparing the IMDb ratings), I watched it with relatively high expectations. I found virtually no laughs in "Spy Hard", but found many in this police spoof, which proves that the mediocrity of SH has nothing to do with Nielsen's starring role.Detective Nordberg, a member of Police Squad, is shot multiple times during an investigation, and is nearly killed! While he is in the hospital, a fellow member of Police Squad, the clumsy Lieutenant Frank Drebin, must investigate this attempted murder. While on the case, Drebin eventually finds proof that Vincent Ludwig, a local businessman, plans to have the Queen of England assassinated during her visit in L.A.! Unfortunately, Drebin accidentally burns the proof of this assassination plot (he ends up burning a lot more than that), and Ludwig is a very well-respected individual, so how will the clumsy detective convince anyone of this sinister plan?!A ton of slapstick is featured in this spoof, and as big a fan as I am of the type of humour, I have to admit that this film may overdo it a bit at times, making some of the gags a tad too predictable. Fortunately, most of the movie doesn't have this problem. In fact, the jokes are often hilarious, whether they are physical gags, or comical lines! For better or worse, there are also some tasteless gags here and there, such as in the scene early in the film where Lieutenant Frank Drebin visits Detective Nordberg in the hospital. If you're into silly spoof movies and slapstick, and are generally not irked by raunchiness and/or tastelessness, I highly recommend "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!" for you!

reviews.review_title: If the world was like this human's would be extinct.
reviews.content: This swill was one of the worst things I have ever seen. I was expecting a truly classic comedy but turns out it was the biggest piece of unrealistic trash. I just cannot get over the fact that the characters were all incompetent. Now occasionally in a real world setting you will get a couple of dumb-asses but if the world was like this it would have exploded already. Leslie Nielsen's character seems like a rip-off of Mr Magoo, at least Magoo was original.I just don't think I will ever get this style of comedy. I just don't think it is funny, interesting or anything new. I swear I did want to like it though but just couldn't.

reviews.review_title: Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker... what else can you expect but a hilarious movie?
reviews.content: *minor spoilers in this review*Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, Jerry Zucker and Pat Proft write a hilarious movie putting Leslie Nielsen as Lt. Frank Drebin, not the wisest cop out there, but sure as hell the funniest. The movie starts off with Leslie saving America from the heads of major Islamic countries... including Yasser Arafat played by a person who's last name is Katz. But it gets way funnier as Leslie Nielsen is put on a case to protect Queen Elizabeth II on her visit to L.A. Leslie Nielsen is just hilarious. Everything from words to visual jokes (like the beaver and bingo jokes and the hilarious scene where he's out on the ledge of the building after setting Ludwig's apartment on fire). Priscilla Presley is delightfully funny as his love interest (the safe-sex scene was cute). George Kennedy and Ricardo Montalban are funny as well. And before his controversial trial O.J. played Nordberg, who has a very bad streak of luck (unlike the real O.J.). Also look for Weird Al Yankovic's cameo as himself and the late Nancy Marchand as the mayor.Doesn't beat Airplane! which will forever be the Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker classic, but is very very funny.

reviews.review_title: Just a Bunch of Bad Skits
reviews.content:
I love good comedy, and even Mel Brooks at times, e.g. "Young Frankenstein" (1974), but this?Awful. Not funny.Here's my breakdown:STORY:
The "story" here is an excuse for skits; an endless string of skits that:1. Have nothing to do with the "story" (most of the time)
2. Are bereft of "ha ha" and is dead airYes, there's an overall story with sub- plots, but it's completely lost in the sea of useless skits.The writers are / were not capable of actually developing a story, or they're just lazy, or both.ACTING:
Leslie Nielsen is actually a pretty good actor, but his skills are wasted on this. The rest of the cast are fine.ENTERTAINMENT:
Poor -> low valueTEMPO:
A messCINEMATOGRAPHY:
Does it matter?DIRECTING / WRITING:
Director: Zucker produced tripe. Sorry, nothing good to say about any of the team here.Writers: (see above comments)Is it a good film? No, it's just poorly developed and executed skitsShould you watch this once? Yes, if you're high and need something stupid to doRating: 4.0 (for Nielsen)

reviews.review_title: One of the best cop parody
reviews.content: I didn't know about this movie until I searched for highest rated parody movies and found out about this one. I watched it and to my surprise, I loved it. It was so entertaining and enjoyable. The story, direction, acting, screenplay, jokes each and every element of the movie was to the point. Even after being 30+ years old, the movie's comedy makes you laugh. It was original than today's comedy movies which are almost forced one.Overall, it was a good parody movie which you will enjoy watching. Now, I am headed for it's two sequels and hoping the same from those.P. S You don't need to watch Police Squad tv series to understand this movie.

reviews.review_title: Funny stuff from the late Leslie Nielsen...
reviews.content: If actor Leslie Nielsen hadn't sadly died on November 28th this year (2010), I maybe wouldn't have watched this. I have seen it many times before but this is the first time I've attempted a review. The trouble with reviewing the work of someone that has recently passed is that you feel you don't want to say anything bad about them. I will, however, try to keep my impartiality. Here's a short summary of the plot before I get into it (summary haters please keep an eye on that crazy baseball umpire while I write the next paragraph).Undercover policeman, Nordberg, has been shot and it's up to inept cop Frank Drebin to find who's responsible. Add to that the fact that Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II is visiting the city and Drebin has his plate full. The finger of suspicion falls on respected businessman Vincent Ludwig and Frank decides to pay him a visit. There he meets Jane Spencer who has been persuaded by Ludwig to get close to Drebin so he can discover what the police know. During his investigation Drebin discovers a plot to assassinate the Queen during her visit. Can Frank find out who shot Nordberg and also stop the assassination attempt on the Queen and maybe even get the girl? So many questions, so little time.A pretty well made film with a very high gag (in the comedy sense) ratio. For me there were surprisingly few 'laugh out loud' moments though. I put it down to the difference in culture between the USA and the UK. We may speak more or less the same language, but what makes us laugh is very different. That isn't to say there were any bad performances, far from it, Leslie Nielsen was excellent as Frank Drebin, Priscilla Presley put in a stellar performance as Jane Spencer and Ricardo Montalban was excellent as Vincent Ludwig. Honourable mentions must also go to George Kennedy as Ed Hocken, O.J. Simpson as Nordberg and Nancy Marchand as the Mayor.I used to love the TV show but I'm afraid it doesn't translate too well to the big screen. It's still pretty good, but I don't think the humour comes across as well when you are bombarded with it for 80 minutes solid. So, over all, not as good as the TV show, but still recommended if only for Leslie Nielson's performance, he will be missed.My score: 7.6/10

reviews.review_title: It is physically impossible to not fall down on the floor while laughing your head off!
reviews.content: Holy crap! This is the best comedy ever made! Even the sequels (The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear -- The Naked Gun 33 1/3: The Final Insult) are just as funny and good! This movie stars the funniest man on the planet (next to Jim Carrey and Billy Bob Thornton) which is Leslie Neilsen (Spy Hard, Scary Movie 4)! This movie also stars other hilarious actors and actresses...such as Priscilla Presley (TV's Breakfast with Einstein, HBO's Tales from the Crypt), Ricardo Montalban (Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over, Star Trek: The Wrath of Khan), George Kennedy (Airport '77, Creepshow 2), and O.J. Simpson (The Towering Inferno, Firepower) in this TOTALLY HILARIOUS movie.The funny parts are so imaginative and creative and belly-laugh-bringers. Leslie Nielsen plays Lt. Frank Drebin character so well. Everyone plays their character so well! Oh my, God, this movie is so hilarious! I know I've said that like three times now, but it's true! Even goth people who never laugh and are obsessed with death and blood will laugh at this movie if they at least give the movie a try. I'm serious, I used to be a horror movie fan (but I wasn't goth, though), but when I decided to try this movie out (it's a comedy by the way...oh, wait, you already know that), and I LOVED IT! I literally watched it at least a hundred times. And I'm only 12 years old! I watched it once everyday last year in a hundred days! And I still watch it, but I lost count now! I love this movie! I also watch its sequels. They're also the best of the best of the best of the comedy genre. If you choose to watch this movie, YOU ROCK! You have a pure, good soul. If you choose to NOT watch this movie, then you need a good psychiatrist because you DO NOT know what you are missing. You only need a psychiatrist if you don't watch it AFTER you read this comment. If you haven't seen it before because you haven't heard of it before, then that's okay.WHAT AM I TALKING ABOUT? BACK TO THE MOVIE! Leslie Neilsen is definitely talented and God gave him a rare and special gift that one-in-a-billion people have. Leslie is so funny and good-hearted. Oh, and so what if he has a girl name? That doesn't make him weird. He's hilarious and he's a very gifted actor that brings belly-laughs in every single movie and TV show he has been in (all 223 of them, he'll be starring in three more movies, two in 2007, which are Music Within and Lipshitz Saves the World...and one in 2008, which is Scary Movie 5!!!) Anyway, this movie is for almost all ages (11 or older) I'd have to say because there is a lot of strong off-color humor and some border-line strong sexuality (but mostly sexual humor) and is not for younger children.See this movie! You won't regret it! **** out of **** 10 out of 10 stars My MPAA rating: PG-13: Off-Color Humor, Sexual Content and Dialogue, and for Some Language

reviews.review_title: This Gun Full of Hit & Misses
reviews.content: What can I say about The Naked Gun. To those of you who love this film I am so happy for you. As for me, I found the whole thing very hit or miss, which is par for the course form this type of film, they can't all be winners and I was well aware of that going in. Now that doesn't mean that they're all misses, because that isn't necessarily the case either. Actually, most of the jokes fell smack dab in the middle, not good and not bad either, just there. Unfortunately, I need more winners to enjoy or recommend a viewing. If you think this film might be up your alley, then go ahead and check it out. If you already think this film won't be your thing, then skip it and move on.

reviews.review_title: Inspiration for "The Naked Gun" opening sequence
reviews.content:
I found a copy of 1974's "Man on a Swing" and decided to watch it because it had Lane Smith, Gil Gerard and Tanya Roberts in it. It's an altogether serious movie about police detectives investigating murdered teens.
This movie opens with a one minute-20 second "one take scene" shot by a camera mounted on the police car roof--behind the flashing light bar. It looks like you see the entire drive from the station to the crime scene.
Perhaps some other police movie had a similar opening sequence. But it's clear this movie's opening scene alone would have been sufficient to inspire the comedic version of the same viewpoint that opens "The Naked Gun".

reviews.review_title: The first part in the Naked Gun-series
reviews.content: Leslie Nielsen's first movie as the pathetic Frank Drebin is without doubt the finest too. Though it has got some flaws and suffers from weak material sometimes, the movie is surprisingly strong and funny, especially as Nielsen's character is being probably the most stupid policeman in the whole world. And it's a classic silly-comedy, featuring dozens of silly scenes leaving no space for it to be mistaken as a serious movie.The movie makes you laugh, that's for sure, because either you will find it so silly that you have to laugh at it, or you find it amusing, and you have to laugh with it. So it's a guarantee success watching with friends, and the Naked Gun is one of the first classic silly-comedies, so it deserves honor for it's originality and sprawling ideas.

The kind of film that proves that a small story can be much more meaningful than a larger one. Here's a rerun of many of the gags from the TV series Police Squad. It's an important film, as well as very entertaining. It is very light-hearted and it isn't complex at all. Visual gags come fast, and it's impossible to catch them all! From an artistic standpoint, there were some plot elements and character developments I didn't think were totally needed. They do however drive the story, which seemed to be their purpose, so I can accept them. Heartfelt and riveting from the first frame to the last. Great performances help to enhance this amazing story.

If "Airplane!" was the movie that proved how funny "Forbidden Planet" star Leslie Nielsen can be (and he can be a riot with the right material), "Naked Gun" was the movie that cemented his reputation in this regard, for better or worse.Nielsen plays Lt. Frank Drebbin, a seemingly incompetent cop who manages to nonetheless to get the job done. In the beginning of the movie, he busts a meeting filled with "evil" world leaders including Idi Amin, the Ayatollah Khomeini, and Gorbachev ("I knew it!" Drebbin yells as he rubs off the mark on Gorbachev's forehead). But when he suspects that a shady character named Vincent Ludwig (Ricardo Montalban from "Fantasy Island") is plotting to kill Queen Elizabeth, nobody except his captain, Ed Hocken (played by another serious actor who shows a great ability with comedy, George Kennedy) is willing to take him seriously. His retractors include the mayor (played by Nancy Marchand, later of "The Sopranos"), who after a series of pratfalls that make Drebbin look like an idiot (it's not hard) takes his badge. But Drebbin is determined to prove his case, even if it means posing as opera star Enrico Pullazo and an umpire to do it, and prevent the assassination of the queen.There's a love story between Drebbin and Jane Spencer, played by Priscilla Presley, who is also not ready to accept that her boss Ludwig is a murderer, and O.J. Simpson provides support (and some of the funniest scenes in the movie) as the hapless Det. Nordberg, who can't seem to avoid getting hurt time and time again. Admit it, it's a hoot watching these scenes now and imagining that the real O.J. is the one nearly being killed.The movie was made by Zucker, Abrahams, and Zucker, the team also responsible for "Airplane!", and is based on the cult classic TV show (cancelled before its time because, of course, it was too much for the dumb TV audiences to be able to follow) "Police Squad!" I think it can be easily argued that it's because of the material provided by these geniuses that Nielsen is so funny; God knows he can't be in anything not created by them. But let's give Leslie Nielsen some credit; NOBODY does deadpan like him. And he gets strong support from the rest of the cast. There are some hilarious one-liners and sight gags here; one of my favorites is the final scene with Nordberg ("Oh Frank! Everybody should have a friend like you!"). Also notable are the cameos throughout, including "Weird Al" Yankovic, Reggie Jackson, Dick Vitale, Dick Enberg, Dr. Joyce Brothers (as a baseball announcer!), and best of all John Houseman in his final screen appearance, playing a driving instructor in a car Drebbin has to take control of for a chase; the poor teenage girl is still driving, and Houseman is calmly directing her on how to do it, as they speed down the highway. This is classic stuff, and even though its not a serious role, I'm glad he had something so memorable for his last movie."Naked Gun" isn't as consistently funny as "Airplane!", but it's still one of the funniest movies ever, and further proof (with apologies to Mel Brooks) that the Zuckers are the greatest spoofmakers of all time.

I can honestly say that I never laughed so hard before watching The Naked Gun.This is simply a masterpiece comedy,the greatest of all time along with the sequels.Trust me you will almost die from laughter.Leslie Nielsen is a comedy genius,an absolute one.This guy plays so well and looks so serious that when he does all the stupid things he does it looks like he's surprised just as much as the audience.Sheer brilliance to the max. The story is simple:Detective Frank Drebin tries to uncover a plan to assassinate Queen Elizabeth II (who is on a state visit to the USA). The main suspect is Vincent Ludwig ,a man (hired by Papshmir, a recurring villain) who has a way of turning anyone into an unknowing assassin at the press of Ludwig's beeper; it appears that the victims are responding to a post-hypnotic suggestion, but the film makes no effort to clarify the point.As he works on the case, Drebin meets and falls in love with Ludwig's assistant Jane Spencer. It is eventually revealed that Jane knows nothing about Ludwig's plot, and after the pair spend the night together, she helps Frank with his investigation.The laughs are more than you can count I can assure you.This spoof of cop movies is excellent watch it immediately.For me the three movies are the greatest comedies of all time.

reviews.review_title: the funniest in the series, and one of the funniest movies of all time!
reviews.content: the naked gun is beyond hilarious. it's got to be the funniest movie of the 80's! and one of the funniest movies of all time. just about every gag in this movie works. the baseball game at the end is just classic. this movie is non-stop funny. some of the funniest scenes you'll ever see. it's non-stop pure fun. the timing of the jokes are just great. for a great beyond hilarious time watch this movie. i give this movie ***1/2 out of ****

The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1998, Dir. David Zucker) When Det. Nordberg (Simpson) is shot and placed into a coma, bumbling Lt. Frank Drebin (Nielsen) of Police Squad, make it his number one target of who is responsible. It leads him into the presence of rich Vincent Ludwig (Montalban) and a plot to assassinate Queen Elizabeth II (Charles).Hilarious spoof which doesn't slow down from start to finish. This was released back when spoof movies actually had a story. Instead of random gags, the jokes are tired together with a well thought of storyline, which shows perfectly why Leslie Nielsen will forever be known as the king of spoof.Frank, they're not here for you. "Weird Al" Yankovic is on the plane.  Captain Ed Hocken (George Kennedy)

I got on with the correct foot with this comedy, as the ferry mafia scene got me in stitches. The remaining scenes in The naked gun part 1 are good enough, with enough ridiculousness and physical comedy to entertain the audience. The problem is, that is all The naked gun can provide.
The lack of depth and too bare comedy makes the movie unrewatchable. Not that it's anywhere bad, but the comedic effect is bound to be lost in the second viewing.

Good slapstick humour in style of Benny Hill
Bit like Hill dated now, but still plenty of laughs and Nielsen carry's the movie with his gift for natural comedy presence
