reviews.review_title: The start of the perfect trilogy.
reviews.content: *** 1/2Starring: Leslie Nielson, Priscilla Presley, and George Kennedy.If there is only one man who can stop a madman from mind-controlling people to kill Queen Elizebeth, it's Frank Drebin.  Frank is a bumbling cop who steps on the plot to kill the Queen, so he must take this into his own hands.  The movie is quite possibly the funniest parody of all time and is the start of one of the best trilogies of all time.

reviews.review_title: From the makers of Airplane!..no, not the wright brothers, the zucker's..
reviews.content: Based on the very short lived (six episodes) tv show the Naked Gun, Leslie Nielsen stars as Lt Frank Drebin who bumbles his way into an assassination attempt on the queen of England..of course there are plenty of laughs along the way...Not up to Airplane! standards but some funny moments.There are also some not so funny ones.. on a scale of one to ten..7

This is the beginning of one of the best and definetely the funniest trilogy out there.Leslie Nielsen is very funny and good as Frank Drebin, a cop who messes up everything all the time but still manages to succeed every time.This movie is really dumb, but in the "good" sense of the word, if there is such a thing. The gags are really funny and yes you do laugh a lot, but the lack of value of this movie made me not give it more than a 6 out of 10.
My all time fave 🤣🤣🤣 Thank goodness it's now available on Netflix.

reviews.review_title: zany,hilarious,among the funniest movies of all time
reviews.content: the naked gun truly is a classic.its laugh-a-minute dialoque and combination of visual,slapstick and zany comedy works like a charm. some jokes may be dry and used but there is more than enough to redeem the film of its occasional flaws. the naked gun is right up there with airplane,top secret and all other slapstick comedies of the 1980's. Naked Gun 2 1/2 wasn't quite as good and 33 1/3 was very funny and quite a rival but the predessor shines the brightest. 7.9 out of 10

reviews.review_title: Leslie Nielsen at his very best
reviews.content: There are few directors who can make a screwball comedy better than brothers David and Jerry Zucker. And there are few actors better at playing dumb, or at remaining straight faced in the midst of travesty than the late, great Leslie Neilson. When you put them together, the results are nothing less than spectacular. Case in Point, The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!, which is one of the most outrageous, side splittingly hilarious comedies ever made.Neilson is perfectly cast as LAPD Lieutenant Frank Drebin, who surely must be related to the legendary inspector Clouseau. After socking it to America's enemies in the utterly ridiculous pre-title sequence, Drebin must save Queen Elizabeth II from an assassination plot at the hands of the dastardly Vincent Ludwig (Ricardo Montalbon). This would prove impossible for the spectacularly incompetent detective if not for one small fact: everyone else in this movie is nearly as clueless as he is. Rarely does a movie combine as many comedic devices, or use them to such effect, as this film. Naked Gun joins together the slapstick of Keaton, the manic energy and one-liners of the Marx Brothers, and the sheer ridiculousness of Monty Python, then dials them up in a way that only the Zuckers can manage. The slapstick sequences build and build, linking together one mishap after another in a way that defies all logic. Their dialog utilizes a one of a kind mixture of double entendre, mixed metaphors, monologues, and self-negating sentences that produce some of the most quotable lines in cinema. Speaking of quotes, watch for delicious parodies of some of the best known lines from famous cop dramas.And before the movie ends, they manage to skewer practically every cliché known to the cop genre. The shootouts, the chases, the interrogations, the tearful meeting with the partner's wife, it's all here. They even managed to spoof the opening credits of practically every cop movie ever made. And no-one understands the comedic power of overstatement more than they do. Their car chases don't end in a massive fireball, they end in three. When they introduce the requisite romantic subplot, they take you through every possible variation of the semi-obligatory lyrical interlude. And when the hero's heartfelt statement of true love comes, it's so moving that it ends the Arab/ Israeli feud. While they were at it, the Zuckers also managed to spoof the Bond franchise, and to include possibly the best sports scene in any non-sports movie. It may not be subtle, or entirely tasteful, or contain any twists that a third grader couldn't predict, but Naked Gun is just about the most fun you can have at the movies. There is not a single moment that passes without a gag, and you'll be laughing so hard you'll hardly have time to breath.

Leslie Nielson rocks in this great spoof of policemen/crime movies.  The entire movie is a hilarious romp and I highly recommend it.  If you want to see a great comedy, then I suggest you see this one.Overall the whole movie, from beginning to end, is wonderful.  Rating BIG 10 out of 10.

This movie is the best Leslie Nielsen movie. I am a big Leslie Nielsen fan and I am proud to say that it is my favorite movie. Leslie Nielsen stars as Lieutentent Frank Drebin. The clumsy head of Police Squad a special division of the LA Police Force. When the someone attempts to assassinate the queen of england at a dodgers game, its up to Drebin and his buddy cop Ed Hocken played by George Kennedy to find the culprit. In the process, Drebin meets and falls for Jane played by Pricilla Presly. Some spoofs of some classic movies but mainly its Leslie Nielsens deadpan performance that makes the movie as good as it is. The movie was based on an unsuccessful television series called Police Squad which starred Nielsen as well. Leslie Nielsen becomes the funniest man alive when put in the directing style of David Zucker. Although Airplane is a great Zucker movie, this movie is the best. The movie also spawned two sequels: The Naked Gun 2 1/2 The Smell of Fear and Naked Gun 33 1/3 The Final Insult. Leslie Nielsen is the spoofmaster king and he is such a joy to watch. This movie is his triumph. If you liked this movie you want to definitely see the sequels, Wrongfully Accused, Spy Hard, Scary Movie 3( not the first two crappy ones) and the upcoming Scary Movie 4. This movie also stars O.J. Simpson (pre-trial) and Ricardo Montolbaun. See this movie and laugh your butt off.

reviews.review_title: One of the best comedies of all time!
reviews.content: Starring: Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, Ricardo Montalban, O.J. SimpsonLt. Frank Drebin (Nielsen) is a real man's man. He fakes his orgasms, loves a nice stuffed beaver, and laughs through comedies like 'Platoon'. Fresh off of kicking terrorist butt in Beirut, Drebin returns home to an empty apartment and a broken heart. Everywhere he looks, there's something to remind him of his old flame: in the smiling faces of happy couples, or a pair of twin breast-shaped nuclear reactors in San Onofre.Enter Jane (Presley), the lovely assistant of real estate tycoon Vincent Ludwig (Montalban), and the woman of Frank's dreams. "How 'bout dinner?" he asks her. She can't make it, but offers a rain-check. "Well, lets just stick to dinner," he replies. They hit it off immediately, but Frank's got bigger fish to fry. Queen Elizabeth II is coming to Los Angeles, and it's up to Drebin and Police Squad, an elite unit of the LAPD, to keep her safe. Ludwig is the villain, and the movie makes it no secret -- by the 10min mark, he's already pumped Frank's partner Nordberg (Simpson) full of bullets. Luckily, Nordberg survives, albeit hospitalized and in critical condition. It's up to Frank and Capt. Ed Hocken (George Kennedy) to counsel his crying wife: "I think what Frank's trying to say is, as soon as Nordberg's better, he's welcome back on Police Squad," Ed explains. Drebin interrupts, "Unless he's a drooling vegetable -- but that's just common sense."If it seems like I'm pumping this review full of quotes, I am. This is one of the funniest movies ever made. I can't count how many times I've seen it, and I die laughing each time. Directed by David Zucker, from a script he co-wrote with his brother Jerry and Jim Abrahams, The Naked Gun is based on a failed TV show the three of them produced for NBC, called 'Police Squad!' That the show was canned after only four episodes seems criminal. The ZAZ Boys, who also masterminded such comedy classics as 'Airplane!' and 'Top Secret!', are gifted comedians with a penchant for exclamation marks. Their gift is in casting accomplished dramatic actors to play everything straight. Kennedy was (and still is) an Academy Award winner; Montalban was one of cinema's great villains, playing opposite William Shatner's James T. Kirk in 'The Wrath of Khan'; Presley had been a prime-time soap star for years. Dead-panned, the words and sight gags speak for themselves -- and they speak volumes. Think I've ruined the best bits? Not even close, and you notice something new every time.FINAL SCORE: 9.3 = AThe movie lives and dies by Nielsen, and Jacques Clouseau's got nothing on this hard-boiled doofus. Kicked off the force, Drebin bites his lower lip and says, "Just think...the next time I shoot a man, I could be arrested." This is classic comedy through and through.

reviews.review_title: The Naked Gun is Leslie Neilsons 2nd best comedy.
reviews.content: The Naked Gun is an hilarious Spoof/Comedy that should go down as the second best Leslie Neilsons comedy(only surpassed by The Naked Gun 2). It is about Lietenent Frank Drebin(Leslie Nielson) and after his best friend and partner gets shot down Frank goes for revenge. The movie is good for many reasons 1. Its spoofs are funny and original as well as its jokes 2. The jokes are always persistent and 3. It starts with laughs and ends with laughs. Overall I think this movie is definitely one of Leslie Neilsons finest comedy's and the movie itself is hilarious. So I rate this movie 94% and if you missed this one somehow you should definitely go out and rent it right now.

The Police Squad series seemed like a very promising sitcom in conception. It is very unfortunate that it did not go beyond six episodes. At least it was revived as a feature film.Compared to AIRPLANE and TOP SECRET, this Zucker/Abrams collaboration has more nuanced zaniness. The sight gags, while still outrageous, seem very natural and subtle. They're not as in your face as the ones in AIRPLANE. The film carries the tone of a typical police drama of the day; so there is still room for romance and sentimentality while not straying far from the comedy.This makes it the best Zucker/Abrams comedy. I wonder what their comic influences were.This has always been nostalgia for me.

reviews.review_title: Featuring OJ Simpson In His First Dramatic Role
reviews.content: There are movies that are a series of sketches put together on the strength of a simple plot. The Naked Gun is one of those movies. The plot? Terrorists want to assassinate the Queen of England while she's visiting Los Angeles. The sketches? They all work. Ingredients for a wonderful movie, all met by the zany Zucker brothers, who also produced the Airplane! movies in the early 1980s. Based on the cult TV show Police Squad!, in which only 6 episodes were made, The Naked Gun follows Officer Frank Drebin (Leslie Neilson) around LA while he does what he does. What he actually does is difficult to explain, but he does it all well enough to be the hero by the end of the movie. Among the sketches in the movie is perhaps my favorite series of events, when the Queen visits a baseball game. Why the Queen of England visits Dodger Stadium to watch the big Seattle Mariners-California Angels game, that's anyone's guess. But between the 7 announcers at the beginning of the game, to Enrico Palazzo singing the national anthem to the umpire frisking all of the players during the game, it is my favorite 20 minute stretch of any movie. Hilarious! The rest of the movie is filled with wonderful moments of comedy, never taking itself too seriously. The film also boasts OJ Simpson in his first dramatic role, and he does well playing a beat up, almost dead guy. He played the part well, wonder what ever happened to that up-and-coming actor?

Fast, Witty, non-stop laughter!!! A spectacular film, Although I werent too excited when I sat down to watch it? I suppose it was because a lot of the American films are the usual run of mill Hollywood bore, but this was better in many ways. First of all it wasnt rubbish, second of all it had actual actors in, third of all it had hilarious jokes in.This sums up a perfect film! The funniest part was when two men were searching Leslie Nielsen, and one of the men held his arms behind his back, and the other guy searched his pockets but he accidently reached into his mate's pocket and got a wallet! he opened it and shouted to the man whose wallet it was: "Hey hes got a picture of your wife!" the man turned Leslie Nielsen around and punched him in the face! See hilarious comedy... should not be missed!This film was great in many ways but always there is a bad point in which you must loose a mark out of 10 for, this is the acting, but in lots of comedys you cant act you must be funny so no comedy would be likely to get 10/10. All because there are either people voting who have no taste in pure hilarious comedy. Or because of the acting in which has to be poor to make it funny.Leslie Nielsen also made a laugh echo over britain and the US as he played a characteristic comic character in Airoplane! Thats what he should be: a comic character. His passionate flirting was almost pathetic although it worked! He has the power to catch the viewer and then take them into never never land (then leave them behind). Basically he catches your eye you sit down laughing, laughing, and laughing and youll be left there with out noticing!Yes Im referring to what happened to me! An 8/10 film lost 1 mark for acting and the other for the whole setting, laughter, character fault all summed up, If you havent see it now! This was a film not to be missed I started off with someone recommending it, and Im pleased! Hilarious, Excellent, Brilliant, Fantastic!!!

The Naked Gun: From The Files of Police Squad! (1988) D: David Zucker. Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, Ricardo Montalban, George Kennedy, OJ Simpson, Susan Beaubian, Nancy Marchand. The incompetent cop from the POLICE SQUAD TV series (Nielsen) sets out to foil a plot to assassinate Queen Elizabeth. The ultimate spoof film, with a gag literally every five seconds. Not nearly as funny as one might expect, but certainly worth a repeat viewing. It practically restarted Leslie Nielsen's career as a spoof leading man. RATING: 7 out of 10. Rated PG-13 for sexual innuendoes, slapstick violence, and profanity.

So I decided to check something on the "Naked Gun" page. And then there it was. This strange force. Drawing me towards the link that allowed me to add my own comment. I tried to resist. After all, I loved the rapid-fire jokes, hilarious one-liners, and deadpan acting no more than anyone else. I had absolutely nothing new to say about "The Naked Gun." But this force was drawing me forward. I felt myself being sucked in. Finally, I surrendered in reckless abandonment and decided, oh, fine, I'd write a superfluous comment that, once again, recommends this movie, even though I had nothing new to say about it. As if I had some kind of obligation to comment about movies I liked a lot. If I don't have anything new to say, then I have no obligation! Or do I? Anyway, this movie is very very funny and highly recommended. (shudder)

It's really funny. Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker, the geniuses behind Airplane!, the biggest laugh-fest of all time, have done it again with this ultra-hilarious movie. Leslie Nielsen is one of the best comic actors of all time (my goal in life is to have seen all of his movies by the way). George Kennedy, O.J., Priscilla Presley, and the like also have funny roles. Some very funny lines (i.e. nice beaver), funny moments, and some great cameos (Dr. Joyce Brothers as an announcer). Plus, we get to see Leslie Nielsen goof up the national anthem, which is something you don't see every day. This is a funny movie, and everyone should see it. Now if only a Naked Gun 4 was made......
Not hilarious, but it has its moments. I appreciate the Maxwell House guy,

This is exactly how to do a parody! Over the years, there have been many imitations, but few can match the sharp wit and pitch-perfect delivery of David Zucker and the rest of the team of writers (Jim Abrahams, Jerry Zucker and Pat Proft). The film is filled with hilarious gags that aspiring comedy writers and directors can learn from. This is not a hit-or-miss comedy. Either the jokes are funny or hilarious. There are very few bad apples in this bunch. First of all, the casting of Leslie Nielsen was genius. It's a shame that we don't see much of him anymore. His timing and delivery are impeccable. Nielsen started out as a serious actor, which I think makes his performance even funnier. If Zucker were to cast a Jim Carrey type in the role, he would try too hard to milk out the comedy in each scene. What makes Nielsen so funny is that he doesn't seem like he's trying to be funny, and as I say time and time again that's how you're supposed to do comedy! It must be done with a straight face! My favorite gag is the one in which Nielsen hangs off the ledge of a building and grabs onto a statue's penis to stop himself from falling down. That scene had me laughing so hard that I was running out of breath! I literally laughed for about 5 minutes straight! Yes, it's that funny! I like the sequels, but the original "Naked Gun" is the best of the bunch. A must-see for comedy fans!

Naked Gun is without a doubt one of the best comedy series of all time. Leslie Nielsen gave the character Frank Drebin life as a slick cop with an always interesting head for thoughts.  He isn't a bumbler like Inspector Clouseau but he is rather funny. The slapstick humor in this movie works out just fine.  From everything as eating a Dugout Dog full of things to giving away remarks regarding Nordberg (O.J. before his tribulation) as Nordberg is seriously wounded.  This show is a complete genius of a show and is rewarded with good stuff.  The other two sequels are sort of going hardcore on the slapstick and should take a breather...

THE NAKED GUN is a genuine laughfest. The climactic baseball game is classic comedy. The script takes unexpected turns and the dialogue is absolutely brilliant. A real pleasure to watch,especially for thechemistry between Leslie Nielsen and Priscilla Presley. The only negative thing about this movie is that O.J. Simpson is in it...

reviews.review_title: not as funny as Airplane or Scary Movie 3, but still offers some good laughs
reviews.content: In this action comedy(more comedy), Leslie tries to stop an attempt to kill The Queen. This was a spoof. And i'm not saying that this wasn't funny, but I think Scary Movie 3 and Airplane was funnier. The laughs were more in the other two and longer. This was funny. Pretty good script, ok acting.I give this a 7/10.PG-13: sex-related humor amd some action violence.

This film might be the funniest I've ever seen. This and the two sequels. I have never before laughed out loud like this. If you want to see a feel good movie, this is the best one to choose.
Leslie Nielsen is incredible

Leslie Nielson stars in The Naked Gun as Frank Drebin of Police Squad. This film is the jewel atop the crown of comedy, this film beats everything into the dust. Forget Airplane, Hot Shots, Scary Movie, this film is the spoof king! First there is the great cast with Leslie Nielson playing the dumb but straight role,George Kennedy provides good laughs as Franks buddy Ed, and I must say I enjoyed O.J Simpson as Nordberg. Then there's the phenomenal script, which starts out with Drebin kicking the crap out of terrorist to Nordberg being shot, burned, caked, toasted, bitten, and stabbed on a ship, but the big plot fills in with the attempt of assassinating the Queen of England (Reggie Jackson makes a cameo here)But the dumb jokes and one liners is the icing on this cake. Examples: "Everything will be alright Mrs. Nordberg, your husband will be fine." "Unless he turns into a mindless vegetable." Drebin being hit with a pillow and he screams as though it's alive. "Don't worry Mrs. Nordberg, nothing will stop me from solving this crime. There is no time to waste! Now lets go get a bite to eat." The whole student driver sequence, the love video with Frank and his girlfriend, and the villain giving a demonstration with the Queens death with his secretary. Examples over. Best movie I've seen in a long time. After reading this, get up, go out, and get a copy of The Naked Gun! Perfect, 10 out of 10. Enjoy!

The first of the three Naked Gun films sets the tone for this insanely silly series. The film essentially takes the unfairly short TV series, Police Squad, to the big screen often merely lifting jokes and scenarios from the latter. The manner in which this transition succeeds must largely be thanks to the lead actor Leslie Nielson who plays Lt. Frank Drebbin the unwittingly chaotic police officer.The storyline doesn't really matter (an assassination attempt on Queen Elizabeth II using mind control), it merely contextualises the Zucker and Abrahams format of incessant humour - indeed such is the barrage of jokes that one needs to watch it several times to get the often interwoven layers of slapstick, innuendo, smut, and wordplay on offer here.The aforementioned Nielson is cast superbly as the lead role as he was in Police Squad but unlike the TV series I believe the supporting cast in Naked Gun is better chosen. Simpson, Pressley and Kennedy all play off the lead, who is in almost every scene, and the result is a fabulously funny spoof film that retains its humour nearly 20 years on.

reviews.review_title: Forget the overrated crap that was airplane! THIS is the funniest movie ever made!
reviews.content: This movie was based on the short-lived underrated TV Series 'Police squad' which gets re-run on paramount quite often -The story:- The Queen of England is in LA and the job to look after security goes to a division of the L.A.P.D known as 'Police squad' headed by the bumbling and incompetent Det. Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) who stumbles on the plot to assassinate the Queen by bad guy Ricardo Montalban.The script is full of one-liners and Nielsen is hilarious as he mesess up time and time again - while finding time to fall in love with Pricilla PresleyCo-Starring:- George Kennedy and O.J Simpson before (ahem!) his downfallMuch better than the sequels:- The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear & The Naked Gun 33 1/3: the Final Insult which weren't bad - but they just had a quick,cheap cash-in feelFinal note:- In the banqueting hall they call The Queen 'her royal highness' she is in fact 'her majesty'My rating 9/10 (a comedy classic)

Funny funny and more funny in fact nearly every moment is funny! Especially the 'sexual assault with concrete dildo' ha ha ha ha! such a good movie almost better than Airplane. Leslie Neilson, man he was great such an amazing performance. Here are a few pointers on why Police Squad is so funny: 1. "I love you"-Norgberg to Frank "I love you to"-Frank, five minuets later "Wait when Norgberg was saying I love you he was saying the name of the boat"-Ed "Yes I realise that now"-Frank. That made me laugh every time I thought about it. Here's another funny line from the same scene: -Norgberg is in hospital and his wife is upset about him being unfit to work at police squad- "Dont worry the doctors say he'll be fit and healthy within weeks"-Ed "and we'll be happy to welcome him aboard police squad as soon as he's better"-Ed "Unless he is a snivelling vegetable"-Frank. I nearly died of laughter! 10/10

Lowbrow comedy at it's finest.  Many people underestimate how hard it is too make good lowbrow humour, the amount of unfunny "spoof" films is a testament of that.Leslie Neilsen is perfect for the lead role of Lt Frank Drebin & is ably supported by the rest of the cast.The final third of the film at the baseball game include some of the funniest scenes committed to film. 8/10.

*Possible Spoilers*
        The Naked Gun is one of the funniest movies ever. From the producers of "Airplane," this film is a hilarious look at Police work. Nielsen is great as Frank Drebin. The film has a number of silly things happen in it. Especially whenDrebin disguises himself as an umpire. I also love it when everytime Frankparks his car, he hits something. That's great. The scene where Frank breaksinto Ludwigs office and finds all sorts of interesting things in there. This is a great comedy. If you liked "Airplane" you're gonna like this. ***1/2 out of ****

reviews.review_title: Leslie Nielsen is the king of Slapstick
reviews.content: "I hereby Crown Leslie Nielsen the king of Slapstick comedy". He's so funny at playing this part of a good cop having a bad day. The good thing about slapstick comedy is that its different to conventional comedy in that it relies on over exaggurations and mimicking things in strange ways to make them funny i.e the fact that he keeps running into rubbish bins and even a fisherman. I'd rate it 10 out of 10.

As disappointing as a lot of the late 80's cinema was, Naked Gun, was a godsend.  The jokes are simple but great and Leslie Neilsen is fantastic as Frank Drebin, the forgetful and incompetent member of the L.A. Police Squad. He's trying to track down and reveal a drug-smuggling and assassin ring that is currently trying to assassinate the queen of England on her visit to L.A.  The results are hilarious.  This movie is a must see for comedy and has many small jokes hidden in the background.  And also, it has the funniest opening sequence of any comedy I know.

With the stupidity of the Police Academy movies and the majority of most 80's comedy, Naked Gun just looks like all of the rest.  But, it is brilliant.  Leslie Neilsen is hilarious in his incompetence as a police officer and his complete oblivious reactions to the chaos he has caused. The subtle jokes in the background are many and the most hilarious of all. You have to pay close attention when you watch this movie, or you will miss a lot of the punchlines.  It is '80s comedy at its best as well as Leslie Neilsen's character he brings to his role.  It is a comedy not to miss.

reviews.review_title: A laugh riot starring Leslie Neilson
reviews.content: The Naked Gun is a great series of slapstick comedy that will make you yearn for simpler times. Leslie Nielson at the end of his career started doing slapstick humor after the tremendous success of Airplane. Naked Gun started as a television show- Police Squad which ran for 6 episodes. The visual and verbal gags are downright hilarious and clever and just looking at Neilson one can start burst laughing. The supporting cast is really good from (ahem) OJ Simpson to Priscilla Presley and all have been etched in our collective memories. If you want a good laugh you cannot go wrong with Naked Gun.

reviews.review_title: By Far One of the Most Funniest Movies
reviews.content: I probably have seen this movie thousands of times and i have always laughed harder each time. This movie is a spoof with alot of laughter plus a fairly good plot to such a ridiculous movie. Leslie Neilson cant do anything else other than spoofs. Its hard to take him serious in some of his older roles. Ive seen funny spoofy movies but this one next to spaceballs is the funniest spoof ive ever seen. There are many movie i feel shouldnt even be at the top where this one should always be.

reviews.review_title: ZAZ's second funniest movie and one of the funniest comedies of the '80s.
reviews.content: The Naked Gun is hilarious from start to finish. Just when you think it can't get any funnier, it does. Rarely is there a gag that feels stale. Leslie Nielsen is at his funniest here at Frank Drebin. Overall, A hilarious spoof thats ZAZ's second funniest movie (second behind Airplane!) and one of the funniest comedies of the '80s.

This movie simply takes your breath away. But not because it's something new, extraordinary or odd, but because you can't breath from laughing! Each and every detail in this movie is made to be funny, and you have to constantly keep watching the whole screen, because something very funny is always going on, if not in the focus, than in the background.The whole (holy) trilogy has its recognizable intro, the police siren going to the most bizarre places in the city (someone's bedroom, toilet, kitchen, etc.) :)Anyway, The Naked Gun will leave a deep footprint in the history of comedies.

I Think The Naked gun was one of the funniest movies ever. I think Leslie Nielsen was funny and it was the Zucker Brothers best movie since AIRPLANE. 
If they ever make a sequel to the Naked Gun Installment, I would most definetly see it.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious movie spoof from genius director Zucker
reviews.content: There would be no Scary Movie's had it not been for Naked Gun. The movie that started the unofficial spoof genre is by far a classic when it comes to comedy movies. And all of that can be traced to one man: Lieutenant Frank Dreblin (Nielsen).I feel I should spend more time talking about Nielsen's character Dreblin: he is the perfect character for a comedy movie: dumbly smart, arrogant, and hilarious. The facial expressions are priceless; you can't describe this type of humor. You simply have to experience it.True hilarity comes from Naked Gun: it has that clever humor where you know the writers and actors aren't overdoing it. While not all of the jokes were perfect, none of them were annoying. Now how many comedies can claim that? Naked Gun is the perfect example of humor that I love. I mean it when I say this: you have got to watch this movie!

reviews.review_title: The best comedy ever. Why? Well...
reviews.content: ...it's consistently hilarious, the whole cast have a funny moment, and Leslie Nielsen is at his best. Lt Frank Drebin, an overly incompetent cop, has to foil an attempt at assasinating Queen Elizabeth II, with moments of comic genius. Examples include when he pees with his mic still on at a conference, when Nielsen and Priscilla Presley practice "safe sex" by wrapping themselves in plastic and when Drebin keeps injuring the already half-dead O.J. Simpson. It's far better than the inferior sequels(which are still alright) and beats 1980's "Airplane!" as the best parody movie. I wouldn't mind if Leslie continued this until he's 90, because he's fantastic.

reviews.review_title: probably my favorite movie of all time
reviews.content: Naked Gun is probably my favorite movie of all time.  It is one of only a handful of movies that I can watch again and again and find the jokes as funny, if not funnier, as the first time I saw them.  Naked Gun is very close to being a perfect movie for me.

Ah, the first Naked Gun. Easily the best of the three, and easily one of the funniest movies ever. Whether you like absolutely silly-funny movies or witty and clever comedies, Naked Gun delivers.This movie is capable of making someone laugh the whole way through. A lot of movies today just try to do absolutely stupid stuff for the entire movie, while Naked Gun requires that the viewer is intelligent. It is therefore impossible that the same person who watches Dumb and Dumber (an absolutely awful movie) can find Naked Gun funny. He is not mentally capable.I think that this is the reason it does not get even close to the credit it should get. This is one of the best comedies ever, from one of the best comedy writing teams ever.

Very good..but I found the sequels better, especially the second one..that was the best! How the americans could only give it a PG 13 though is beyond me..especially when it has a concrete dildo involved and when huge condoms are thrown around. A 15 used by the British Film Classification Authority is much more adequate!

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies of the 20th century.
reviews.content: Yes, the movie was dumb, the plot had holes in it, and there was little character development, but who even cares? As soon as the movie starts, to the very minute it ends, the gag never stops. There is not one moment when a joke is not happening, at that is what makes this movie so funny. I was smiling throughout the whole movie. I was giggling throughout most of it. I was historically laughing at least 10 times, and was even in tears twice. The acting from Leslie Nielsen who plays a hilarious and oblivious policeman was perfect for his role, and it made the movie. This is as movie that I could re-watch multiple times and never get bored, because of the energy that this movie gives out. All of the actors looked like they were having a blast making this, and at the end of the day, thats what makes a movie good- when the people involved are having fun with it. The only gripe about Naked Gun that I have is the dumb and cliché plot, but it worked for this type of story just fine, and barely took me out of this movie that I love.

reviews.review_title: Not bad, but, ah, those memories.
reviews.content: This film, though sometimes funny, is somewhat of a cheat. This is not because it was taken from a TV series ("Police Squad"), or that the name of the series was changed for the big screen. Rather, it is because Leslie Nielsen's character is turned around with respect to what he was on television. The world of "Police Squad" (all six episodes of it) is like that of "Airplane," one in which, for example, a female witness can ask detectives to wait while she "changes" and come back a completely different person, or where the scientist down at Police Squad headquarters can demonstrate ballistics by showing how far a bullet can penetrate through a row of Barbara Walters interview tapes. Nothing quite make sense to us, but it does to them, which is one reason why the series was so hilarious.On "Police Squad," the occasional exception to this state of affairs was Lt. Frank Drebin (Nielsen), who seemed to be the only one who could perceive that a statement was too ludicrous even for his universe (which he would indicate by pausing, grinning slightly and saying "Well . . ." and then moving on).In the movie, however, Frank becomes something of an Inspector Clouseau: clumsy, accident-prone, annoying to his superiors. This is not at all what he was in "Police Squad." There he was the ultimate good cop: loyal, smooth-talking, respected by his colleagues and bosses downtown. The viewer must judge for himself which version he likes better. I, of course, preferred the old version, mostly because I am just old enough to remember why Nielsen was chosen to be in "Airplane," namely, because the straightness of most of his roles up to that point only served to emphasize the zaniness of the script.Yes, this is probably too much analysis for a simple comedy. I just miss the television series. In brief: "Naked Gun" is entertaining fare, though it is certainly no "Airplane" or even "Police Squad." Too much slapstick, not quite enough wit.But excellent opening credits.

reviews.review_title: A complete review in as short as possible...
reviews.content: The Naked Gun: A complete review in as short as possible...The Naked Gun is one of those few classics that prove that the originals are always the best! This movie is fast-paced, just too funny and the BEST comedy movie I have EVER seen! A non-stop one-way comedy-derby that you'll never want to end!Nielsen puts on his very best performance, making one think he saves it all for the Naked Gun movies! The casting is PERFECT, the support cast is excellent, the soundtrack is brilliant, the story is just what the doctor ordered! There can never be as funny a Naked Gun movie as this!!Oomph!-meter (from 5): *****

This movie is just too funny.  I own the movie, and have seen it many times. This is one of Leslie Nielsen's best comedies ever.  Hey, it even features O.J.!!!!  It is sort of funny to see him in movies after all this junk about the murder.  Anyway, Frank Drebin is a bumbling idiot cop in this movie, and some of the things he does are just hilarious!!!!  This movie gets a 8/10. It was ranked down for some real repetitive jokes, doing the same thing over and over just gets lame after awhile.  Rated PG-13 for sex, language, and sex related humor, this movie is fine for around 13 and up.

The Naked Gun is hilarious.  It's the kind of movie that you can watch over and over again and still laugh hysterically.  Montalban is brilliant, and overall I think the movie is much funnier than the TV show(Police Squad). It includes some interesting foreshadowing with O.J. Simpson playing Nordberg, a cop who gets nearly shot to death while prowling around in an all black costume at night.  This movie is far funnier than any of the Saturday Night Live spin-offs or anything by Adam Sandler, Mike Meyers or Chris Farley(RIP).

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies ever!
reviews.content: First off, I'm new at reviewing. So I'd appreciate it if someone could tell me the limits of reviewing a movie without warning about spoilers.Anyways, this is one of the greatest comedies ever created. From hilarious, speechless scenes, to great one-liners, this movie is also the greatest police movie spoof. It's a great reprise of the short-lasting series that was somewhat-recently released onto DVD, Police Squad... IN COLOR! Leslie Nielsen did a great job acting as well. He managed to make the role an actual character, just like in Police Squad. I doubt anyone else could've pulled off the part perfectly.

"The Naked Gun" and "Airplane", both by the same directors, rank on my list as 2 of the funniest movies ever made. The perfect mixture of slapstick jokes, satires of the classic cop movie, political jokes, and just plain silliness makes "The Naked Gun" a great comedy for all ages.Leslie Neilsen as Frank Dreben is the best and most memorable role of his career. All of the supporting actors give credible and hilarious performances as well. The jokes come rapid fire, and most surprisingly of all, there is an actual plot that is interesting, a rare commodity in today's "satires" like "Date Movie" and "Epic Movie".Two thumbs way way up!

MINOR SPOILERS:This movie has had the status of classic bestowed upon it, which i find frankly ludicrous. How can a film which features a scene of barely disguised sadism right at the start, (which involves an ordinary cop being burned, shot and humiliated), takes in many sexist jokes, then finally takes pleasure in an act of unintentional cannibalism be funny? Leslie Nielsen doesn't act in this movie, he merely remains stubbornly wooden, then falls down when the script requires it. The real problem about this "comedy" is that it doesn't care about its characters. Even farces, such as this, should treat their protagonists with a modicum of respect, and not to do so makes laughing at them seems cruel, rather like kicking a puppy who can't walk properly yet. This is crude junk, a smear on film history, and is a waste of your time. Watch it if you want to feel depressed.

What are some of the Funniest lines in this movie? Frank: It's true what they say: Jane climbs a ladder Frank: Saayyy, nice beaver. Jane Spencer: producing a stuffed beaver Thanks. I just had it stuffed. Frank Drebin is emptying out his files after being kicked off the force Frank: Hey! The missing evidence in the Kelner case! He really was innocent! Ed: Frank, Kelner went to the chair two years ago. Frank: Well, uh... Frank Drebin quickly shoves the evidence back into the file cabinet Jane Spencer: I wanted you to know, now, I've loved you since the first day I met you, and I'll never stop. I'm a very lucky woman. Frank: So am I... Drebin searches a drawer Frank: Bingo! pulls out a bingo card

reviews.review_title: One of the most funniest movies ever
reviews.content: The Naked Gun Trilogy is nothing but a classic. I'd hate to see people reacting badly to this trilogy just because they're sensitive to perverted stuff. But still, you will laugh and blow your brains out. Watching this, with some pizza and Coke, I nearly spit out pizza from my mouth about five times, and actually sprayed Coke on my table three times. It was so unusual for me, I actually counted. Leslie Nielson is a classic, and it's truly a pity someone as funny as him in great movies like this one go to waster by acting in retarded and pointless films. Naked Gun may not be the smartest film made, but it has a genius on it that can NEVER be beaten. Watch this film and bring some napkins.

reviews.review_title: The funniest movie of... what year is it again?
reviews.content: Before I move on with this, my fifth review for IMDb, I'll run you down on what my star ratings mean. 1 star (which I gave to "Batman and Robin") means that a film is abysmal or worse, and has virtually no redeeming qualities. 2 stars (which I gave to "AVP") means that I found the film to be terrible, and only has one or two small (sometimes very small) positive attributes. I gave "Alien3" 4 stars, which means that I found a film mediocre. A film that receives 4 stars has some good things going for it, but has serious problems that hinder it from succeeding, and I overall don't like it very much. I gave "Fantastic 4: Rise of the Silver Surfer" 7 stars, which means that I thought the film was good. While it has a few obvious problems, I still think it has enough good qualities to outweigh them, and overall I find it solid. My next target is "The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad". Because this is a spoof, I have to judge it on how funny I thought it was, and how good the comedic performers are. I"m giving this film 9 stars because it made me laugh myself silly.The Positives: -In the vein of their previous films, the Zucker brothers have given us a film where the jokes either hit or miss. For me, I don't recall any moments where they missed. -Leslie Nielsen is in his prime here as Lt. Frank Drebin, and he sells every laugh without breaking a sweat. The entire supporting cast (even O.J. Simpson!) perform admirably here.The Negatives: -Sometimes, the jokes are so silly and/or juvenile that you feel guilty for laughing so hard at them. Seriously, you will laugh when Drebin's love interest falls down the stairs, even though you see it coming.My 3 choice words: Hilarious, Silly, Entertaining

What can I say? This is humor at it's best.Never before have I seen a movie with so many corny, offbeat, humor and jokes. They came early and often, and after you watch this movie and don't come out laughing or smiling, then something is wrong.This is slapstick comedy at its best

reviews.review_title: As good as Airplane! if not better
reviews.content: This film hits all the right buttons!  Hilarious word-play, visual puns, and deadpan delivery from Neilson make this one of my all-time favorite comedies.  Throw in Priscilla Presley as the sultry love interest, Ricardo Montalban as the villain and you've got comedy gold.  If you've been living under a rock for the past decade, run out and SEE THIS FILM!

reviews.review_title: A TOP NOTCH COMEDY FROM A T. V. SHOW
reviews.content: Leslie Neilsen is great as he reprises his television role as LT. Frank Drebban from Police Squad this time he must try to foil a plan to kill Queen Elizabeth 2 at a local Braves game. But he must first get through his feelings for a cop lover played hilariously by Presilla Presley. O. J Simpson has a small role as an idiot cop named Norbert. I give this film 3 stars out of a possible 5.

The Naked Gun is one of the greatest spoofs ever made. Most of the jokes are original and hilarious. Once you see this movie it at the least put a smile on your face.It is a smart, clever film that goes at a fast pace. The reason it goes at such a great pace is that they have hilarious jokes when the movie is reveling the plot. Which I think is the way most comedies should be. Everyone who wrote the script are comics who show their skill by making a completely funny movie.Leslie Nielsen is a cop, who falls in love. At the same time when his partner goes to the hospital, he thinks someone is trying to kill the Queen of England. That's what makes this movie great, it's structure. This is one of Leslie Nielsen's best performances ever.Ha, ha, ha, ha. That is what you will be during the complete film. I would suggest this film to anyone that likes spoofs or comedies. It is a great spoof and a film.Rated PG-13What I think it should be rated and why. PG-13 for sexual content sometimes crude, some language, and comic violence.
The plot is decent, but more than it is a roller coaster of laughs. The 2nd and 3rd part of this movie series can get a bit boring at times, but this one was a non-stop entertainer.

reviews.review_title: Easily the funniest film of all time!
reviews.content: Without plucking any of the golden jokes from the multitude, I will safely say that I've never found a movie I've laughed over more.  Sure, it's slapstick, but it has enough class to keep lame parody/spoof jokes to a minimum, and relies on smart dialogue (snicker) and sight gags for a perfect comedy.  There is no fear of picking this one up and not enjoying it.  I personally guarantee it!

If you want to specifically cheer yourself up, then you need to watch the director's Naked gun David Zucker.The film tells about the most ridiculous detective Frank Drebin, who is investigating the case of an international assassination attempt on Elizabeth II.The tape gives the impression of a murderously funny comedy, which simply abounds with great jokes after which you roll on the floor with laughter.If you compare a Naked gun with modern comedies, from which you want to vomit after watching the amount of vulgarity, (with rare exceptions) this painting will generally be a masterpiece.This is the case when jokes will be incredibly funny for all people, no matter what.Conclusion: There is no need to talk about such films, they should be watched! I can't say anything more. And if you haven't seen this cult comedy, run to watch it.7.6.

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest films every.
reviews.content: This film is one of my favourite comedies.  Leslie Nielson is great as Frank Drebbin, and most of the other members of the cast are great too.  There are louds of gags in this, and most are very very funny.  The plot, sense and taste all take second place to the comedy.  Anyone with a sense of humour will love this.

What else is there to say, except this movie, much like all the ones involving Leslie Nielson, is a comedic masterpiece.  There's never a dull moment right from the beginning to the end.  In my opinion the best part of the movie is the pre-credits sequence with Frank in an undercover job overseas, but I won't spoil it for you.  The Weird Al Yankovic cameo is also nice.I give it a 9 of 10 (I have a strict policy on not giving tens unless it's the best movie ever, and while this is among the best I've seen, it's not the greatest.

reviews.review_title: The funniest movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: I remember going to see this one in the theaters. It is the only movie that ever had me (literally) rolling on the floor. I laughed til it hurt and at times, the laughing was so intense that I remember wishing that they'd stop the movie for a minute so I could catch my breath :) The reason I think this one worked so well (and the reason why pretty much all movies of this type after it sucked) is because a lot of the situations were believable. For example, when Drebin is at the press conference and goes to take a leak and forgets to turn of his mic (hehe), something like that could actually happen. Compare this to some of the sequels in this series and those that came after it which have situations that are just *way* out in left field. Not that this movie doesn't have some of those, but it just doesn't seem so obvious. Some people compare this movie to Airplane, but I personally think Naked Gun is much better - a masterpiece. I haven't seen a movie nearly as funny as this and I don't imagine I ever will. If you like movies like Airplane, Hot Shots, and Wrongfully Accused and have never seen this one, shame on you :) Rent it today!

An side splittingly hilarious movie that will leave your sides aching. This is one of the most funniest movies of all time. The comedic timing is perfect and Leslie Nielsen is at his best. There are too many jokes too mention and you will realise after the first five minutes that you are watching a classic. 9 out of 10

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest slapstick comedy films ever
reviews.content: The Naked Gun is a great series of slapstick comedy that will make you yearn for simpler times. Leslie Nielson at the end of his career started doing slapstick humor after the tremendous success of Airplane. Naked Gun started as a television show- Police Squad which ran for 6 episodes. The visual and verbal gags are downright hilarious and clever and just looking at Neilson one can start burst laughing. The supporting cast is really good from (ahem) OJ Simpson to Priscilla Presley and all have been etched in our collective memories. If you want a good laugh you cannot go wrong with Naked Gun.

a blast throughout, though the movie makers made similar movies before and after the naked gun movies with the same type of jokes, and the leading actor seemed to get quite the identical roles in comedy flicks afterwards, it never worked out as well as this naked gun movie franchise, one hilarious silly bit after another, and i guess that kind of comedy won't age, only the playing field scene seemed a bit dragged out, the sequels are just as fun if not funnier really.

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest films I have ever seen.
reviews.content: This is one of my favorite comedies of all time. Leslie Nielson stars as Lt. Frank Drebin, a cop who doesn't play by the rules. Hell, he doesn't follow ANY rules. This movie has great Airplane-style gags and Drebin doesn't waste any time screwing things up. Too bad the sequels aren't quite as good.

They don't make them quite like this anymore. I first saw it when I was 8 and I thought it was hilarious back then but I took it at face value and didn't get all the jokes as I was too young. Now I get them and it's even more hilarious. I'm surprised that the Police Squad show was a failure back then.Still, this was great and Leslie Nielsen is just brilliant as Frank Drebin. There are plenty of gags and it doesn't go overboard or try too hard to impress it's audience like 'Scary Movie' or other spoof movies of today that push the envelope of vulgarity to attain cheap laughs. This was flat out comic genius by the men who know their craft. The Zucker brothers. Sequels kind of sucked but few sequels are better than the original.

The Naked Gun is a great series of slapstick comedy that will make you yearn for simpler times. Leslie Nielson at the end of his career started doing slapstick humor after the tremendous success of Airplane. Naked Gun started as a television show- Police Squad which ran for 6 episodes. The visual and verbal gags are downright hilarious and clever and just looking at Neilson one can start burst laughing. The supporting cast is really good from (ahem) OJ Simpson to Priscilla Presley and all have been etched in our collective memories. If you want a good laugh you cannot go wrong with Naked Gun.

reviews.review_title: One of the best Comic movies ever
reviews.content: Naked Gun is definetly one of the best movies of the genre, ZAZ are the best bunch of guys in writing those screenplays, I must have watched this film at least 20 times and each time my finger pushes play it's continous laughter till the last photogram. Leslie Nielsen (Frank), George Kennedy (Ed), And O.J.Simpson (Nordberg) all get thumb up, I,m still waiting for the 44 and 1/444.Carlo

I have a special place in my heart for this title. "The Naked Gun" series is, I believe, the first series I saw Leslie Nielson in, and I loved him ever since. This series, along with "Airplane!" and "Spy Hard," are some of the best slapstick films ever made---and arguably some of the best comedies ever made. "The Naked Gun" is full of hilarious slapstick and situation comedy; and Leslie Nielson, with his distinctive, side-splitting acting, makes it all the more funny. I recommend this movie to anyone, no matter what sense of humor you have, because chances are you will like it if you have any sense of humor at all.

A lot of films have tried to capitalize off Naked Gun's success. They can't. In this film everything works. The zany humor of Zucker and Abraham along with Nielsen playing the bumbling detective is played to perfection. The first in the Naked Gun trilogy starts off with a bang as Dectective Frank Drebrin must clear his friend Nordberg (O.J. Simpson)who is under suspicion of dealing heroine. THings get even more confused when the Queen of England arrives on her tour of America. A non stop array of gags and slapstick keeps the film moving and keeps the audience laughing. There is some crude humor, but it is kept in check and better than most comedies that come out these days. Overall this film is very enjoyable to watch and one of the best comedies ever made.

This is the perfect movie.  It's amazing that every single attempt at humor in this film hits the mark.  I've watched this way too many times, and each time I pass by it while flipping the channels, I sit there and watch it again.I'm a huge fan of the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker trio.  I would list this, Airplane! and Top Secret as my three favorite movies of all time.The best part about this movie is Leslie Nielsen's performance.  In recent films, Nielsen has played his characters as clowns who are trying to be funny.  That's a major mistake.  In The Naked Gun, he plays Lt Frank Drebin as a serious character(much like his performance as the doctor in Airplane!), and it really makes the movie.

Absolutely one of my favorite movies. I find new, funny things I missed every time I watch it. And I have probably seen it 50 or 60 times. But, if you are not into slapstick humor, then this may not be the movie for you. Otherwise, enjoy.

Classic comedy by makers of "Airplane."  Nielsen is so good as Lt. Drebin. Great spoof of cheesy detective films and romance ones too (see life size condom scene).  So many great parts.  My favorite: when Hocken says there is a 10 % chance of there being a 50/50 chance of Nordberg recovering.  This is truly great comedy, reminiscent of Peter Sellers as the bumbling Inspector Clouseau.  I'm split between Sellers and Nielsen and the Pink Panthers and Naked Guns, as to which are better.  Who cares, their all great.

If your in the mood for a laugh you should watch The Naked Gun as i have on many occasions sometimes just to cheer me up. I have found few films too match the naked guns comedic brilliance and their fractured take on the u.s police force. This film contains a performance of pure brilliance by Leslie Nielson who has shown people that he is the master of spoof films {Mel Brooks not included} This laugh out loud performance by Nielson is excuse alone to watch this film but is supported brilliantly by George Kennedy, O.J Simpson, Priscilla Presley and Ricardo Montalban. This film's "plot" is basically the queen of England is visiting the states and Frank Drebin of police Squad is put in charge of security while a terrorist organisation plan her assassination and only Luitenent Frank Drebin of Police Squad can stop it. Cue the laugh out loud slapstick,one liners and completely off the wall antics in The Naked Gun.

There are few movies that you can watch over and over and over again without it getting old and tired.  This is one of the few that evokes interest and laughter and has been since it's release some twelve years ago. Catch it whenever and you too will be a fan.

This is a great movie based on the short lived 1982 TV series "Police Squad" that only produced 6 shows !!!! One of my fav. parts is when "Weird Al" Yankovic is on the airplane. If you haven't seen this film YOU SHOULD!!!!!!

The Naked Gun is a great and funny movie.  It is full of very easily understood comedy.  I loved this movie so much that i decided to own it, and purchased it some time ago.  My personal favorite part in the movie is when Priscilla Presley goes up onto the ladder to get some files and such and Leslie Nielsen says, "Nice beaver!"  It always makes me laugh out loud. I highly recommend this movie to anyone who wants a good chuckle.

This film is the first of the hilarious Naked Gun trilogy.  I never tire of watching this film.  The thing that makes the Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker films funnier than other comedies is that the acting is so "dramatic," yet, the actors get very silly lines and situations.  Rent, no, buy "Naked Gun"; you will be laughing constantly while watching it.

I have seen many movies, and many comedies. But this is still one of the greatest comedies of them all.It contains that kind of humor that I love. It's a classic.Leslie Nielsen delivers a great performance as the cop Frank Drebin. The cop who always solves the crimes. Not with intelligence, but with his foolishness and stupidity.And because of his reputation as the "stupid cop" no one believes him when he finds out that a man named Vincent Ludwig tries to assassinate Queen Elizabeth. He is sure in his case, and will not rest before Ludwig is arrested. But cops needs something to put people in jail. Envidences! So Frank need to prove that Ludwig is a bad guy, and it results in many funny situations.The movie is 19 years old, but it's still a great movie, everyone should watch.

A perfect example of humor taken to the utmost extent, Leslie Nielsen does what no other actor could have with a role whose only job is, quite literally, to make Priscilla Presley, and OJ Simpson, The Naked Gun is a comedy success that will continue to keep audiences rolling for years. As Lt. Frank Drebin, Nielson falls into the case of a lifetime when his friend Nordberg (OJ Simpson), is severely injured in a police raid gone bad and information surfaces that there may be an assassination attempt against the visiting queen of England. From that point on, this movie contains classic elements of perseverance, adventure, and true love, but uses them all to produce a satire on police life and life in general. There will be many who don't particularly for this movies brand of humor, but The Naked Gun isn't going anywhere anytime soon.

reviews.review_title: You can not watch for more than 5 mins. without laughing...
reviews.content: Great comedy with wonderful sight gags. My favorite line (repeated in subsequent "Naked Gun" movies) is when Drebin holds out an open pack of smokes and says "cigarette?" and the 'offeree' responds, "yes, I know." It still cracks me up. Funny, funny stuff.

If you haven't seen Naked Gun you don't know what you have been missing. This is by far Leslie Nielsen's funniest film.  This film is the original of its kind.  It is the kind of movie that you have to watch over and over again to catch all of the funny things in the backround.  I'm sure you have seen many movies similar to this, where there are funny things that happen in the backround, but Naked Gun is what paved the path for these movies. If you for some reason haven't seen this movie, then you need to go to your local video store and rent it!

Everyone who has seen The Naked Gun knows that there is a blatant parody of Batman in the film (when Frank murders the henchman in the Dugout Dogs factory, the man's outstretched hand lowers into the green goo just like the Joker's does in Batman; that shot of the hand, and the setting of both scenes look very familiar, and the same in some cases). The only problem is that Batman was released in 1989, a year after The Naked Gun was released. Therefore, did Batman copy off of The Naked Gun? Was that scene in the movie even a parody of anything? Explanations, comments, or theories would be useful in understanding this discrepancy.
not enough nudity for a movie called naked
The funniest nonsense terrorist movie ever before Zohan, perfect when you only have 80m to kill. WTH Wahahahahaha....lol
Hysterical. One of my favorites.
Cheap laughs. Dry humor and a lot of fun

Basking in slapstick humor and goofiness with an on-point lead performance from Leslie Nielsen, the first Naked Gun film understands mostly what it is, despite some of its farce and disorienting substance.
Good clean love, without utensils

Despite having more than its fair share of extremely low-brow humor, The Naked Gun is, more often than not, laugh out loud funny.  The perpetually incompetent Lt. Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) stumbles across a devious plot to assassinate Queen Elizabeth and, with the assistance of his only slightly more competent partner Ed Hocken (George Kennedy), embarks on an outlandish journey to save the day.  While a ton of jokes miss the mark, the vast majority are comedy gold, including some extended set pieces that have to be seen to be believed.  While the cast, which includes the likes of Ricardo Montalban, Priscella Presley, and O.J. Simspon, among others, is great and do a solid job, the movie is stolen by Nielsen, whose deadpan delivery never fails to come through.
Best of Movies/TV Series Collection

An All Time Classic Comedy and one The Best Films as well! While both this & Airplane! are 5 Star Classics I personally prefer The Naked Gun because you get More Leslie Neilson. The Deadpan straight faced acting Excellent in this and each actor really has comedic chemistry as well. The jokes are still outstanding in this and are very well set up, intelligent, and made my cheeks hurt by the end I was laughing so much. Fantastic Editing, Pacing, and very effective cinematography that keeps the focus on the jokes at hand. An All Time Classic!

Basking in slapstick humor and goofiness with an on-point lead performance from Leslie Nielsen, the first Naked Gun film understands mostly what it is, despite some of its farce and disorienting substance.
This movie remains a masterpiece, even after 30 years, and no film has since been more funnier. Great plot, great jokes, great cast, especially Leslie Nielsen who plays the best part of his career.
This movie is so amazing and very funny.
Top-tier humor. They genuinely don't make them like this or airplane. The dry humor is exactly what I look for in movies. Leslie Nielson's character never fails to get a laugh out of me.

I couldn't find a place to review the Seattle Mariners latest baseball commercial so I'll write it here. Holy cow that Seattle Mariners baseball commercial was creepy in the most wholesome way possible. I can't help but be suspicious of any baseball fan. WTF man. You can't pretend to be that innocent without becoming suspect. You might as well have had Eddie Haskell in it. I don't trust you, ever.

Ok, so I just watched this movie after watching the six episodes of Police Squad! (Did I somehow make it through youth in the 80s in the US without watching either, at the time? I think I basically did, though I'm sure they were on in the background at some point.) Tbh the series was snappier. The hammy nature of several of the bits was more hammy, because of episode-to-episode repetition. Norberg and Hocken have funnier stuff to do in the series and better dynamics with Drebin. The love interest in the movie has some funny moments but also a lot of dull ones. I'm sad that the shoeshine guy didn't make an appearance; I always looked forward to his part in Police Squad! All in all, the movie has a lot of really funny moments, but it also drags, and I kept wondering when / if it was going to pick up.

I watched this as part of watching a series of cop shows; I was interested to try to understand more about this genre which has been so expansive in American cinema since the 70s, to try to figure out why it has been so compelling, in various forms, and whether it tells us anything about this moment of competing demands: to defund the police, to recall left-liberal prosecutors, to puncture the mystique of the police in the aftermath of an abject, sickening failure like in Uvalde. However, I am too lazy to deconstruct anything, so I mostly just watch the movies and shoot fish in a barrel. (I love shooting fish in a barrel! Sometimes, I get one! And it always makes me happy. However, it's kind of messy. I've been thinking about trying a net.)

Police Squad! and Naked Gun are interesting in this regard in that they sort of survey the tropes that had become standard over the 70s and early 80s in cop shows, boil them down, and exaggerate them for yuks. Honestly, I would have to think more about where some of these come from. The early 70s renegade cop movies I've been watching are great for understanding the bleeding edge of the ideology and the desire, but they don't offer the most boiled down version of the tropes that later became standard.

One low-key aspect of this first Naked Gun movie that I liked: when Drebin plays, for what seems like it's aiming at stupid fun, something that turns out not to be funny at all -- in fact, he killed five actors who were putting on a Shakespeare in a Park festival (and not just any actors, but good ones!), or he finds exculpatory evidence for a guy who was already sent to the electric chair, or he laments, upon the possibility of losing his badge, that the next time he shoots someone, he could be arrested. You could easily overlook these short, deflating moments, but they tell the truth about policing in a way that a lot of cop shows don't. All of this bumbling isn't *just* for yuks. Ok, it's 98% for yuks, but it's also maybe 2% serious about quietly planting the idea that all this bumbling might not be just fuzzy and endearing. Of course, the cops still get the bad guys, every time, and the Dirty Harry fanboys probably just kept laughing.

Leslie Nielson's death last November was a big shock to me. Sure he has been in some bad films, such as 2001:A Space Travesty, but he had also made some quintessential classics such as Airplane, the only film of his career I consider better than this, and the Naked Gun series, of which this is the best. Whatever the outcome of the film, that doesn't stop me from considering Nielson a comedy genius.

The Naked Gun:From the Files of Police Squad! is fast, furious, zany and most importantly, enormous fun film. While it looks great, is wonderfully directed, brilliantly paced with seldom a dull moment and has energetic music and a fun story, it is the humour and acting that really makes this film so good.

The dialogue is deliciously dry-witted, and the plentiful juvenile gags never cease to be hilarious. Nielson gives one of his career's best performances in a wonderfully deadpan characterisation as an likable inept character. The support performances from Priscilla Presley, George Kennedy and OJ Simpson are equally great, but special mention has to go to Riccardo Montalban who just oozes cool.

Overall, a hilarious film. Forget rubbish like Disaster Movie, 2001:A Space Travesty, Meet the Spartans and Epic Movie and watch the classic spoof movies like Young Frankenstein, Airplane, Galaxy Quest and this. You won't regret it! 10/10 Bethany Cox

David Zucker's absurdist crime comedy The Naked Gun (1988) is very funny with outrageous gags and creative visual direction that keeps you on your toes. If you look away from the screen for even a moment, you'll miss like 3 different jokes going on in the background. It's not as hilarious as Airplane! or Top Secret!, but The Naked Gun is still a classic comedy with plenty of laughs.

Leslie Nielsen can deliver any goofy or joke line in a perfectly serious deadpan voice and it is funny every time. He's so calm given all the strange and hilarious situations that I'm always entertained by Nielsen's shenanigans. Priscilla Presley is surprisingly funny and keeps up with Nielsen's absurd energy. You never buy their romance or like the endless string of sex jokes there for a quick crude laugh, but their comedic chemistry is more important. The Naked Gun has it all, even Top Secret! superfan Weird Al Yankovic!

Ricardo Montalban is excellent as the villain. His casual manner tells you everything you need to know with a more nuanced performance than some of the more colorful characters in The Naked Gun. George Kennedy plays a gung ho cop who just allows Nielsen to do whatever he wants with reckless abandon and it's great. I love how The Naked Gun cast O.J. Simpson just to beat the hell out of him.

Writers Jerry Zucker, Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, and Pat Proft make efficient use of their 86 minutes to tell a silly story with as much visual flair and comedic insanity imaginable. I will not spoil anything in The Naked Gun, so that all the jokes are fresh, but I will say that the breakin and baseball gags are glorious.

In short, The Naked Gun will always be a comedy worth revisiting for a series of rapid fire laughs.

The Naked Gun Review
	The Naked Gun has plenty of comedy. The protagonist Frank Drebin ends up getting himself in the most hilarious situations. It has toilet humor, sexual humor, and a fair amount of dirty jokes in it and it's all done brilliantly.
	In The Naked Gun an incompetent policeman named Frank Drebin sets out to prevent an assassination attempt on Queen Elizabeth the Second.
	The funny thing about Frank is that he's not only incompetent but also flawed in many other ways. He has difficulty reading between the lines such as when he steps off a plane and assumes since he's one the first people off the plane that the microphones, and crowd cheering is all set up for him but it's really set up for Weird Al Yankovic since he was on the same plane. He also lives in a very poor manner. In his apartment he has lots of old outdated food in his frig.  
	There's one toilet joke in The Naked Gun which involves Frank using a toilet, which is funny in itself because it's literally a toilet joke. It's a quirk in which Frank forgets to take off a radio mic during a press conference before he goes to the bathroom and this results in everyone at the press conference hearing him go to the bathroom.
	The Naked Gun also has sexual quirks which is appropriate considering sexual quirks are generally associated with toilet humor. There's a hilarious quirk which involves Frank using a dildo and getting in trouble for it. There's also a funny moment in which Frank and Jane, his partner, decide to overly use protection for them having sex.  
	Frank ends up getting himself in lots of funny situations. He goes to a baseball game because he finds out that that's where the assignation attempt on Queen Elizabeth the Second is supposed to take place. The fact that Queen Elizabeth II is at a baseball game is funny because it's the last  kind of place that you would expect her to be because she's with a bunch of people who are the exact opposite of what she is because they're:  uncivilized, unsophisticated, and not very royal. One of the funny situations involves Frank going undercover as an umpire and he doesn't even know exactly what to do as an umpire at first. He goes undercover as an opera singer and gets in trouble for it. 
	The Naked Gun has off the wall funniness and it also has many situations that Frank and other characters get themselves in and the comedy in it is brilliant.

Before the '90s gave rise to The Dude from "The Big Lebowski," and the 2000s gifted us "Borat", there was ludicrous "The Naked Gun" and the legendary Frank Drebin, played with the straightest straight-face ever by the remarkable Leslie Nielsen. "The Naked Gun" comes from the ancestory.com chart originating with "Blazing Saddles," most readily identified by the mighty "Airplane!," and most recently carried forth by raunchy music industry satire "Stadium Anthems."

Gags in "The Naked Gun" rain down like biblical flood; some are deceptively high-brown, but most gloriously inane. It takes absolute geniuses to create such elevated stupidity.

Is "The Naked Gun" somehow even better than its "Airplane!" forefather? By a nose, the vote here is "yes." While "Airplane!" also features Nielsen as a doctor (arguably even more straight-faced than Frank Drebin), that film's central character was the adequate Robert Hays, whereas "The Naked Gun" gives us Nielsen as the prime purveyor of every last morsel of hilarity. This is simply one of the greatest and most influential comedies in the history of film. - WATCHED IT? THEN WATCHLIST:
"Top Secret!"
"Stadium Anthems"
"Hot Shots!"

Naked Gun

Naked Gun is a plot driven comic crime about a cop whose clumsy actions turns everything whimsical after he touches it. It weaves out an intense sequence with such sincerity that you fall for it and then it mocks it away on all levels where you find yourself practically all giddy up for more. 

But amidst all these tomfoolery it fiddles subconsciously with the viewers and somehow manages to reach a definite point that is put up front with crystal clear voice. With a zazzy yet incongruent background score, annoyingly loud sound effects, daft cinematography and amateur editing, it falls flatly on face on technical aspects. All the husbandry gags are just cherry on top that makes you root for it more and more as it ages on screen. 

Ticking for around 90 minutes, the tightly packed screenplay never lets you wander off its sketchy world, it may be illogical but it's hilarious, it may be redundant but it somehow is feasible and it may overdo sometime but it works like a charm. Neilson's comic timing is off the hook, he hits a home run on every throw and its his expressive or inexpressive face is what fuels this comic into a bit more than one anticipates for. Because at certain points even writers may fall short but he delivers every time and every line. 

His ludicrous attempts to not only convince others but himself too, is what makes him stand alone than any other actors in here, his strong belief in each and every gag is clearly visible through his mannerism and tone. Zuker's execution barely matters in here, it is good but armed with such an attention seeking script one rarely wonders about it. 

Naked Gun might be an attention seeker, but why not just give it to it, there won't be any regrets.

The Naked Gun is a great series of slapstick comedy that will make you yearn for simpler times. Leslie Nielson at the end of his career started doing slapstick humor after the tremendous success of Airplane. Naked Gun started as a television show- Police Squad which ran for 6 episodes. The visual and verbal gags are downright hilarious and clever and just looking at Neilson one can start burst laughing. The supporting cast is really good from (ahem) OJ Simpson to Priscilla Presley and all have been etched in our collective memories. If you want a good laugh you cannot go wrong with Naked Gun.

The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! is directed and co-written by David Zucker, and it stars Leslie Nielsen in a comedy about a lieutenant who's in a crime that he has to solve, but he's really not that bright, and he come across in a romance with an assistant. When it comes to the Zucker Brothers being together, they tend to make some comedies that are a classic. So with this, it's also a classic that is just as fantastic as Airplane!. Leslie Nielsen is really good at taking things seriously in a very comedic way that brings out a lot of laughs. It's interesting to see that it doesn't entirely make it obvious about who the villain is, and even if it did, that's probably because he was in a film that was one of the well known films of all times. I like how in a detective spoof like this, it still has the interesting detective stories that could be taken seriously as a action detective film, but also doesn't give out the whole case out in the beginning, just the basis of it. The writing by Jerry Zucker, Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, and Pat Proft give out a lot of jokes for us to handle, and they kept hitting the mark as I kept laughing so much in it. Frank Drebin is very likable and silly to watch that you can't help but find him enjoyable. The Naked Gun is a fantastic film that it's sad to see that this is the last film where the Zucker Brothers and Jim Abrahams were involved together.

With HollyWood nowadays you come to see all of the same movies. Sure they have different plots and different casts. But it's really the same movie. You have your Horror movies and then dramas and then action movies. We as audiences wanted something completely different. Now I'm not saying that I hate these kinds of films but I wanted new ideas instead of reboots. Thus The Naked Gun was born. Well I can't really say that this movie was original because was based on a TV show. But this gave us something new for audiences to sink their teeth in. Thus with The Naked Gun, the spoof genre was born cranking out film like Scary Movie and Epic Movie. The Naked Gun combines some of the funniest humor that you can get from a film. It's like the filmmakers of this movie were like "If we're going to scoff all of these spy movies, then we have to do it right"! And the filmmakers clearly show it. This film not only combines the best speaking humor, but also the best visual humor. And this movie is jam-packed with all of this kin of humor. Like in one scene Frank (Leslie Nielsen) says "Nice Beaver". The girl Jane (Priscilla Presely) says "Thank you, I just had it stuffed" She then pulls down an actual stuffed Beaver from the attic. When you watch the movie and see the joke you'll get it. The Naked Gun is a funny comedy and I totally recommend it.

I've always been a fan of well-made spoofs and farcical comedies, and I've often held up the Naked Gun series as a shining example of how good this genre used to be.  Sure enough this movie gets me laughing more than anything manufactured by the Wayans' brothers.  I must admit, though, that the first 2 acts of the movie struggle at times to keep a consistent level of comedy.  There are moments where the jokes fall flat, and it sometimes struggles to recover quickly because they keep working through those ineffective jokes.  However, when the 3rd act hits, this is easily one of the funniest movies I know.  From the second they arrive at the baseball game I am just in tears with laughter, and it does not stop until the credits roll.  In fact, I actually had to remind myself there were some slower parts of the movie as soon as I was done watching, because I'm on such a high from that whole final sequence.  I'll also quickly address the one reservation some people bring up with these movies: "Isn't it weird/hard to watch these films with O.J. Simpson in them as a cop, considering what we all assume he did?"  It could be, however, since his character (Nordberg) is constantly getting the crap kicked out of him in these movies, it kind of works.  In fact one could even consider it somewhat cathartic to watch him get shot, punched, and dropped so frequently.
